00024 #ifdef _WIN32
00025     // The file's constructors make heavy use of the 'this' pointer, in a safe
00026     // manner. MSVC isn't smart enough to know that it's safe.
00027     #pragma warning(push)
00028     #pragma warning(disable: 4355)
00029 #endif

00031 #ifdef BOOST_XINT_DOXYGEN_IGNORE
00032     // The documentation should see a simplified version of the functions.
00033     #define BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_INITIAL_TPL template<...>
00034     #define BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL template<...>
00035     #define BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE integer_t
00036 #else
00037     #define BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_INITIAL_TPL template <class Alloc = \
00038         std::allocator<detail::digit_t>, bool Threadsafe = true, bool Secure = \
00039         false>
00040     #define BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL template<class Alloc, bool Threadsafe, bool \
00041         Secure>
00042     #define BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE integer_t<Alloc, Threadsafe, Secure>
00043 #endif

00069 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_INITIAL_TPL
00070 class integer_t: private detail::digitmanager_t<Alloc, Threadsafe, Secure>,
00071     public any_integer
00072 {
00073     public:
00074     typedef BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE type;
00075 
00078     integer_t();
00079     integer_t(const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& b, bool force_thread_safety =
00080         false);
00081     integer_t(BOOST_XINT_RV_REF(type) b): any_integer(*this, 1) { _swap(b); }
00082     explicit integer_t(const char *str, size_t base = 10);
00083     explicit integer_t(const char *str, char **endptr, size_t base = 10);
00084     explicit integer_t(const std::string& str, size_t base = 10);
00085     explicit integer_t(const xint::binary_t b, bitsize_t bits = 0);
00086     explicit integer_t(const any_integer& other, bool force_thread_safety =
00087         false);
00088     template <typename Type> integer_t(const Type n,
00089         typename boost::enable_if<boost::is_integral<Type> >::type* = 0);
00090 
00091     #ifndef BOOST_XINT_DOXYGEN_IGNORE
00092 
00093     integer_t(const detail::data_t c):
00094     detail::digitmanager_t<Alloc, Threadsafe, Secure>(*c.holder()),
00095     any_integer(*this, c.length, c.negative) { data.beginendmod(); }
00096     #endif
00097 
00098 
00107     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& operator=(BOOST_XINT_COPY_ASSIGN_REF(type) c);
00108     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& operator=(BOOST_XINT_RV_REF(type) c) {
00109         _swap(c); return *this; }
00110     template <typename Type> BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& operator=(const Type n) {
00111         BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE nn(n); _swap(nn); return *this; }
00112 
00113     bool operator!() const { return data.is_zero(); }
00114     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE operator-() const;
00115     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& operator+() { return *this; }
00116     const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& operator+() const { return *this; }
00117

00122     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& operator%=(const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE b);

00164 
00165     void _swap(BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& s) { using std::swap;
00166         swap(data, s.data); }
00167 
00168     private:
00169     BOOST_XINT_COPYABLE_AND_MOVABLE(type)
00170 };

00176 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL
00177 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE::integer_t(): any_integer(*this, 1) {
00178     // Don't need to do anything, already preinitialized to zero.
00179 }
00180 
00191 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL
00192 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE::integer_t(const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE& b, bool
00193     force_thread_safety): detail::digitmanager_t<Alloc, Threadsafe,
00194     Secure>(*b.data.holder()), any_integer(*this, b.data.length,
00195     b.data.negative)
00196 {
00197     data.beginendmod();
00198     if (force_thread_safety && Threadsafe == false) data.make_unique();
00199 }

00319 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL
00320 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE::integer_t(const any_integer& c, bool):
00321     any_integer(*this, 1)
00322 {
00323     if (c._data().is_nan()) throw exceptions::not_a_number();
00324     data.duplicate_data(c._data());
00325 }

00339 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL
00340 template <typename Type> BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE::integer_t(const Type n,
00341     typename boost::enable_if<boost::is_integral<Type> >::type*):
00342     any_integer(*this, 1)
00343 {
00344     if (std::numeric_limits<Type>::is_signed) data.set_signed(n);
00345     else data.set_unsigned(n);
00346 }

00645 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL
00646 template <class Type>
00647 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE::random_by_size(Type& gen,
00648     bitsize_t size_in_bits, bool high_bit_on, bool low_bit_on, bool
00649     can_be_negative)
00650 {
00651     detail::random_generator<Type> rgen(gen);
00652 
00653     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE r;
00654     detail::random_by_size(r._data(), rgen, size_in_bits, high_bit_on,
00655         low_bit_on, can_be_negative);
00656     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00657 }

00686 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL
00687 template <class Type>
00688 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE::random_prime(Type& gen,
00689     bitsize_t size_in_bits, callback_t callback)
00690 {
00691     detail::random_generator<Type> rgen(gen);
00692 
00693     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE r;
00694     detail::random_prime(r._data(), rgen, size_in_bits, callback);
00695     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
00696 }

00738 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL
00739 typename BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE::divide_t divide(const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE
00740     dividend, const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE divisor)
00741 {
00742     typename BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE::divide_t r;
00743     divide(r.quotient._data(), r.remainder._data(), dividend._data(),
00744         divisor._data());
00745     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);

01235 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TPL
01236 BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE operator%(const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE n1, const
01237     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE n2)
01238 {
01239     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE r(n1._data() % n2._data());
01240     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);
01241 }

01254     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE n2)
01255 {
01256     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE r(n1._data() & n2._data());
01257     return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r);

01376 #define BOOST_XINT_ANY_COMPARE(rtype, op) \
01377     template <class Alloc, bool Threadsafe, bool Secure, typename N> \
01378     rtype op(const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE n1, const N n2) { \
01379         return op(n1, BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE(n2)); \
01380     } \
01381     \
01382     template <typename N, class Alloc, bool Threadsafe, bool Secure> \
01383     rtype op(const N n1, const BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE n2) { \
01384         return op(BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE(n1), n2); \
01385     }

01396 #define BOOST_XINT_ANY_MATH(op) \
01397     template <class Alloc, bool Threadsafe, bool Secure, typename N> \
01398     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE op(const integer_t<Alloc, Threadsafe, \
01399         Secure> n1, const N n2) \
01400     { \
01401         BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE r(op(n1, integer_t<Alloc, Threadsafe, \
01402             Secure>(n2))); \
01403         return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r); \
01404     } \
01405     \
01406     template <typename N, class Alloc, bool Threadsafe, bool Secure> \
01407     BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE op(const N n1, const integer_t<Alloc, Threadsafe, \
01408         Secure> n2) \
01409     { \
01410         BOOST_XINT_INTEGER_TYPE r(op(integer_t<Alloc, Threadsafe, Secure>(n1), \
01411             n2)); \
01412         return BOOST_XINT_MOVE(r); \
01413     }

01435     std::basic_ostream<charT, traits>& out, const integer_t<Alloc, Threadsafe,
01436     Secure> n)
